info.title: eCAS account maintenance APIs
info.description: **eCAS account maintenance APIs** The Client Account Services(CAS) Account Maintenance APIs support instructions to create, amend or delete sub-accounts. Users may initiate APIs to create new sub-accounts, make amendments to existing sub-accounts (this includes name and address) as well as request to delete an existing sub-accounts. Status of these requests can be tracked via the sub-account maintenance status API.

tags.name: Client Account Services (CAS)
tags.description: Account and Transactions APIs enable registered third parties to securely retrieve Standard Chartered's customers account information and transaction data.

post.summary: Client Account Service – Create Sub Account
post.description: The Client Account Service - Create Sub Account API exposes the ability to create a single eCAS Sub Account under a Master Account. Upon successful validation of required parameters it returns an acknowledgement as a representation that a Sub Account creation request was received successfully. To check the status of a specific Sub Account, you are required to use the Client Account Service - Sub Account Status Enquiry API and/or subscribe to notifications via webhook, which provides the current status of the Sub Account request.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

401.description: Access token has expired. Please refresh the token

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates error on the webserver hosting the API

503.description: Microservice dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.summary: Client Account Service – Modify Sub Account
post.description: The Client Account Service - Modify Sub Account API exposes the ability to modify a single eCAS Sub Account under a Master Account. Upon successful validation of required parameters it returns an acknowledgement as a representation that a Sub Account modify request was received successfully. To check the status of a specific Sub Account, you are required to use the Client Account Service - Sub Account  Status Enquiry API and/or subscribe to notifications via webhook, which provides the current status of the Sub Account request.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

401.description: Access token has expired. Please refresh the token

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates error on the webserver hosting the API

503.description: Microservice dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.summary: Client Account Service – Delete Sub Account
post.description: The Client Account Service - Delete Sub Account API exposes the ability to delete existing single eCAS Sub Account under a Master Account. Upon successful validation of required parameters it returns an acknowledgement as a representation that a Sub Account deletion request was received successfully. After deletion, this Sub Account record will not be available for payment initiation. To check the status of a specific Sub Account, you are required to use the Client Account Service - Sub Account Status Enquiry API and/or subscribe to notifications via webhook, which provides the current status of the Sub Account request.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

401.description: Access token has expired. Please refresh the token

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates error on the webserver hosting the API

503.description: Microservice dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.summary: Client Account Service – Sub Account Status Enquiry
get.description: The Client Account Service – Sub Account Status Enquiry provides the ability to retrieve the Sub Account status for a specific Client Reference ID. The Sub Account status returned will be the status at that point in time and the timestamp within the message will indicate the effective time of the status.To determine if a Sub Account request has completed processing you may poll the API repeatedly with negligible performance impact. Alternatively, you may use the Webhook capability to receive push notifications instead of polling

parameters.name: clientReferenceId
parameters.description: Client Reference ID of the Sub Account request

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

401.description: Access token has expired. Please refresh the token

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates error on the webserver hosting the API

503.description: Microservice dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

accountId.description: Master Account Number of the sub-account

companyIndicator.description:
Company Indicator
Possible Values
YSub Account Holder is a business unit
NSub Account Holder is an individual

masterRebateFlag.description:
Master Rebate Type Indicator for the Sub Account
Possible Values:
YMaster Rebate Type will be the Rebate Type for Sub Account
NThe updated Rebate Type entered will be the Rebate Type for the Sub Account
DSub Account deletion

rebateType.description:
Rebate Type for the Sub Account
Possible Values:
PPrime Rate
FFixed Rate
NNo Interest

spreadOrFixedRate.description: Spread in % if Rebate Type is Prime Rate (P) or Fixed Rate

masterTargetBalanceFlag.description:
Master Target Balance Indicator for Sub Account
Possible Values:
YMaster Target Balance will be the Target Balance for the Sub Account
NThe updated Target Balance entered will be the Target Balance for the Sub Account

masterWhtFlag.description:
Master WHT Indicator for Sub Account
Possible Values:
YMaster WHT rate will be the WHT Rate for the Sub Account
NThe updated WHT Rate entered will be the WHT Rate for the Sub Account

accountId.description: Unique Account Number for Sub Account  Holder

masterTargetBalanceFlag.description:
Master Target Balance Indicator for Sub Account
Possible Values:
YMaster Target Balance will be the Target Balance for the Sub Account
NThe updated Target Balance entered will be the Target Balance for the Sub Account

reasonForClosure.description: Reason for Closure of Sub Account

id.description: Unique Identification Number of the request for tracking purpose

number.description: Account Number for which the balance and transaction information being returned

swiftBic.description: SWIFT BIC of the Financial Institution

bankId.description: Bank BIC Code for which transaction history is requested

currency.description: ISO Currency Code of the account

groupId.description: Internal SCB Identifier known as account ID

clientReferenceId.description: Your unique Reference ID for Client Account Services(CAS) Maintenance request

statusCode.description:
Status Code
Possible Values:
2300Processed
23Completed (created / modified account successful)
9Completed (closed account successful)
15Rejected

additionalInformation.description: Status description updated by the interface application

adviceType.description: The type of advice - Credit or Debit

messageSender.description: This should be a constant tag to identify the senders system, it is used for audit and diagnostics. Defaulted as your Corporate registered name

messageID.description: Unique Identifier for the transaction. This should be a unique tracking value (GUID) to identify the request, it is used for audit & support

countryCode.description: Used to identify the country of request origination

timestamp.description: Timestamp of creating the subaccount request. Must be a valid ISO format timestamp of this message, i.e. time message was generated in the form YYYY-MM-DD’T’HH:mm:SS.SSSZ (UTC), Example:2019-01-01T13:30:32.010Z

identifier.description:
Possible Values
CSub Account creation
MSub Account modification
DSub Account deletion
